Ratings.comment: There's a lot of assignments, but he makes them group assignments. Quizzes are online but are taken in class and are fairly easy. Offers two extra credit assignments. CARES SO MUCH for his students! Gives extra lecture on his free time for people who are struggling w/ SQL, and he sends out internships opportunities, however he's a bit unorganized.

Srikanth is extremely knowledgeable and pragmatic when it comes to teaching. He wants his students to get the most out of his class and does the highest level of analysis I've seen from any professor on case studies. He encourages those who are on the right track and points out flaws in wrong responses for the class to learn.

knowledgeable and sounds like a good researcher. But, cons are - fear of humiliation, embarrassment to share thoughts or opinions, disrespectful to students, egoistic, tough grader, course structure was not good for 50% of the course, too much of discussion on a simple point, could have spent time more topics.

Srikanth is no doubt a brilliant researcher, but he has no idea how to manage a classroom. The majority of class is Srikanth asking students reading comprehension questions. When he does ask open ended questions, he just criticizes students' ideas. Also, the student-assigned case presentations are busy work, as he presents on every case anyway.

Extremely boring teacher. You can tell that he wants to teach and help but just cannot connect to students. Would highly recommend finding a different recitation person, not because its overally hard, just because he is really boring and bad.
Poor teacher. If u choose this teacher for your recitation. U cannot get A even if u attend every class. U still get a poor grade from participation even if u talk several times in class.

You have to buy the Harvard case studies but you don't really have to read any cases except the case you're assigned. You're graded on attendance and participation so make sure you talk a lot in class. Everyone seemed to really dislike the way he lectures but you can tell it comes from a good place. He genuinely wants us to learn.

Very average course with a very confusing grading system. Many of the midterm essays I wrote got random grades with no explanation as to why they were graded the way they were. Still a very easy course though.

My class was at 8 am and I only came twice and got an A. Everything is online and Rafael is chill himself. When working on the short essays he's grading criteria is a bit weird for it and he gives no feedback b/c of all the students but just use the slides and don't use AI.

The class is self-guided, no need for a professor at all. Repetitive assignments and busy work. Exams aren't difficult but the five short essays for each were a hassle. Nothing in the course is extremely difficult to grasp.

Average professor, not amazing not terrible. He responds to emails fairly quickly. The class is a decent amount of work/fast pace. But the material isn't hard. Also, the midterm short essays were graded oddly.

His class is boring. Though much of the homework for his class is extremely easy. His grading system is very different. He grades his exams at random. The exams are essay driven and he just slaps random grades on different students to get the average he wants. When asked about his grading, his percentages didn't add up and he avoided the question.

Rafael was extremely unorganized, this made the exam grade more difficult than it should have been. Tons of busy work. You learn on your own and not in the class. He also never admits if he is wrong, you could explain exactly what an answer is but he will say you are wrong then say the answer is exactly what you said but in different words.

Easy class but VERY disorganized. Tons of wrong due dates, grade confusion.. etc. Rafael seems like a nice guy but he seems like he does not care about this class at all. Frequently was late to class as well because "traffic".The essays are computer graded and the criteria can be pretty random and unfair. Rafael is very negligent towards this class

Weirdest grading system ever and would constantly mess up grades, only correcting them if you emailed him (awful at responding to emails too btw). Exams consisted of short essay responses, I think he graded them using a random number generator because there simply was no consistency. Overall, easy class but this guy made it miserable.

He is so overrated. The class content is easy but he is so disorganized with the delivery. Half of his announcements are about mistakes he made with due dates or with grading. He does not provide any criteria for the midterm essays then provides no feedback when he dings points. Exams are most of your grade. Extra credit helps. Avoid him.

Average professor. Class on its own is pretty easy. Weekly smart-books, some pack-backs, and 2 tests. The tests consist of 10-15 multiple choice questions and 5 short essay questions. Your short essay responses could answer the question perfectly and for some reason he will not give a good grade for it (my only issue with him).

Dr. Corredoira is a great professor. His class consisted of two quizzes every week, an occasional discussion, and a 5 question written midterm and final. There are a lot of assignments, but they are easy. I have no complaints about this class. It was the easiest class I took at Fisher college. If you have the choice, take it with him.

There is so much homework for this 1.5 credit hour class. Thankfully the class is SUPER EASY. Just do the work and you'll get an A. The midterm and final is based on 5 short essays (250-300 words each) and they are super easy points. I can not stress this enough, this class is super easy.

Just read the textbook and do all the assignments. I really didn't study for any of the exams just because if you get an 84 that's an A. I ended up getting B's on both exams and still got an A in the course.
Just read the textbook and go to class and you will do fine. Overall a really easy class, the exams are always very straightforward and he curves a lot.

This class was super easy. Only half a semester and I took it online. Lectures were sort of repeating what I read in the textbook, so I feel like I didn't get anything extra out of his videos. Overall material is very straightforward, lots of extra credit opportunities, and his tests aren't hard. Solid choice for a gpa buffer.

Very knowledgeable about international business. This course is only 7 weeks but there are a lot of assignments, and they can be confusing to access. The 7 weeks did go by fast though, and theres only a midterm and a final as far as exams go. Would recommend this class!

By far your best choice for International Business! Posts his lectures online, easy but also very helpful homework each week, cool accent, and simple grading scale. I'd say you'll have about one to two hours of work per week for this class which is very manageable. Read the chapters and study his slides before his tests and you'll be fine! Take him

This class is good for a hard semester. I just read the chapters the week of the exam and watched the lectures for review. As long as you know the major topics you're good. Exams were relatively easy, but somehow 50 multiple choice questions equates to 600 points. He gives a lot of EC and the online hw and quizzes you should get 100% on easily.

Extremely easy class. He doesn't seem to know how to use the online quiz and homework platform correctly, but it doesn't really matter because he will curve for all of his errors. Do the assignments and show up for the exams. You will get an easy A. His lectures aren't necessary its better to just read.

My phone was dead before the final and I cannot log in to carmen to review for the exam. So I emailed him ask if I can take the make up exam right before the exam for me. He responded immedietely and allowed me to take the make up exam without a second thought. I am so glad and thankful and he is a truely honorable man.
He is an amazing professor! One of the best Ive had at OSU by far. He is very caring and his exams are as straight forward as his exams

Not sure what the person beneath was talking about, but the exams were super easy except for 3-4 questions if you read the textbook and can remember the bold words. Class was a big joke because if the grading scale. Only needed 1400+/1600 points. That almost an 87% if you want an A which was extremely easy. If you have a busy schedule take this.

I took the online version of the class. The class is organized pretty well. Each week has about an hour or two of basic work. Exams are about 75% of your grade, and they are pretty difficult (Midterm and Final). The other 25% is weekly assignments, which are pretty much participation points. Definitely the easiest business core class.
The grading scale is confusing, but the homework and exams are fairly simple. If you stay on top of the online assignments you'll get an A.
Didnt expect to get an A but there was an excessive curve that allowed for it to happen. Weekly assignments are easy. Exams were somewhat hard but like I said there was a generous curve.
Curved a LOT, missed assignments and got B & C on the exam and got an A as final grade
She used some fresh HBR cases which is not something I can say about many. Maybe too much emphasis on attendance but clear and fair grading nonetheless.
Participation is key to pass. Group project is a must. Recent and cases like Tesla and Uber are cool to read.
Best GenAI course at Fisher.
Best coverage of GenAI so far at Fisher.
Covers GenAI. Probably the most current class I've taken at Fisher.
Best AI class at OSU.
The course covers the latest developments in artificial intelligence. The lectures are very engaging. The problem sets can be challenging and require some coding. Excellent class overall.

Probably my favorite professor thus far at Ohio State. Super interesting subject material along with real world current examples and a very clear love for teaching. Also, didn't require us to mass write code which was super refreshing. Grade consists of 5 problem sets and a final project with a group.
Great course. He clearly loves teaching.
Course covers latest tech (not stale). Homeworks are challenging, but not a problem if you ask for help. Great class.
Best professor for artificial intelligence and machine learning! Enthusiastic about the subject. Amazing experience.

SEI.Subject: BUSMGT
SEI.Class Name: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Business: Decisions from Data

SEI.Subject: BUSOBA
SEI.Class Name: Business Analytics: Application of Predictive Analytics to Business Data

SEI.Subject: BUSOBA
SEI.Class Name: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Business: Decisions from Data

SEI.Subject: BUSOBA
SEI.Class Name: Business Analytics: Application of Predictive Analytics to Business Data

SEI.Subject: BUSOBA
SEI.Class Name: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Business: Decisions from Data

SEI.Subject: BUSOBA
SEI.Class Name: Business Analytics: Application of Predictive Analytics to Business Data

SEI.Subject: BUSOBA
SEI.Class Name: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Business: Decisions from Data

Ratings.comment: Professor Rathjens is alright he outlines his lectures pretty well, but goes on tangents sometimes that have nothing to do with the lecture. For example he'll bring up politics, and try to relate it to what he is talking about. This course only has 3 tests as the only grade and that is it. He does a pretty poor job preparing the class for the tests

My previous comment got taken down where I was more descriptive. He's just an odd dude who makes really odd political statements that bleed over into his tests. Some of the test questions are super confusing or about such wild topics that it can be hard to understand what he's asking for. Don't go to lecture, just read the comments in the slideshow

great professor, 3 exams and some extra credit opportunities, if u take notes and understand the slides u don't need to go to lecture, understanding, willing to help, if u truly understand material u will get what he's trying to ask on the exams, decent amount of the questions have answer choices that are easy to rule out, Nice professor overall!

Don't understand how there can be a single positive review. He's definitely writing the positive reviews on his burner account. This professor is atrocious, class structure, exam questions, lectures, etc. I did better on exams after I stopped going to class, his lectures are a waste of time, unless you want to learn about how his political views.

I cannot believe this guy is making a burner account. There is no way anyone could enjoy the way this professor teaches the class. The questions were always a guess, not fair, and made no sense. He literally had to throw out 5 questions on the first exam (out of 50), because his writing is so bad. Avg grade was still a C.

Professor Rathjens makes the already boring class more boring. Lectures were hard to follow and there are only 3 tests and 3 extra credit opportunities. The tests are harder than you would think and he words some of the questions weird which confused me more. I don't recommend you take him if there's another option
Made a very bland subject incredibly engaging in lecture. Enough extra credit opportunities to make up for being mostly exam grades. Great professor.

He made some pretty funny jokes on some of the exam answers - definitely made the exams more enjoyable.
The only grades in the class are the three exams, which scared me at first. But, he offers enough extra credit to make up for it (plus it's nice we didn't have to spend any time on homework). Good class overall.

It's his first year teaching so I hope he improves but WOW, this guy needs help. I never knew writing exam questions was so difficult. 60% of questions on the exams don't make sense. On top of it all, he snuck in his political views whenever possible, even in exam questions. Avoid this professor, there are plenty others.
Avoid at all costs. Exams are so poorly written and students statistically do better if they do not go to class.

Only graded based off the 3 exams with 2 research study opportunities for extra credit; however you are only given a few days notice so if you have a heavy work schedule like I did you won't be able to make it to those. Claims this is the only plausible set up for the course even though no other professor has ever had this issue. dont go to lecture

Grades are entirely based on the 3 exams and there are no other assignments along the way to test how you are doing with the material. Lectures are not required so don't bother going because all he does is read off of the posted lecture slides in a monotone voice. Exams are nothing like the practice exams and come from lectures and 100+ book pages.

Absolute fraud. Not posting anything and claimed its technical issue while making super unclear announcement that things will be fixed which did not happen. The grade is solely based on 3 exams only and they are not even available along with the missing lecture module. I've spend $62 on textbook and feel like being scammed.

Great professor that actually cares about her students. The layout of this class is pretty straightforward with a few assignments per week and all the exams are open note. Highly recommend taking this class if you need a GE or Elective credit.
Great Professor

Dr.Kendall is a great professor and really cares for her students. She makes the class very clear and there are a couple of small assignments per week. Overall, the class is pretty light and you don't have to spend much time outside of class doing assignments or reading the textbook.

Lori was well organized and quick to respond, however, her lectures were very boring. I took this course online and often had the lectures in double speed, but by halfway through the semester I wasn't even watching them. This course was easy to do well in but I didn't gain much from it. It worked for my GE credit though.

Dr. Kendall was great in a shortened 6-week summer class. Her lectures were engaging and the course expectations were always clear. The assignments weren't bad at all and she offers plenty of extra credit. Definitely recommend this professor and class to anyone who wants to get a taste of entrepreneurship.

Her lectures were like TedTalks half the time. She is very sweet. It was a GE that I found out didn't count towards my degree but still, it was nice to hear her talk abut the importance of living and how it relates to business.

Lovely, Woman. She tells personal stories related to the class, which I found fascinating. She's just a good person. Her classes are straightforward, and she genuinely wants everyone to succeed. She has a high retention rate for a reason.

I really enjoyed her class. She was very easy to communicate with and the assignments were very fairly graded. She is very understanding and clearly passionate about the subject. I would recommend this class to anyone!

Lori was amazing! I loved her lecture style and she definitely tried to change things up once in a while. She has a tech background though so be prepared to focus of a tech based startup at points. If you are taking entrepreneurship, USE THE STUDY GUIDES! Not sure if she posts them for all her classes, but they are a life saver.

I loved professor Kendall! She was always so sweet. You can tell she loves what she teaches and wants her students to succeed. I had to miss some lectures due to my career outside of school and she was always very kind and understanding. As long as you put in the effort to complete all the assignments time you should be good to go in this course.

Prof Kendall is genuinely a great professor. You can just tell by the way she lectures that she has a ton of experience on her hands and is very well-respected in her department. She knows how to command a room as well but is very easygoing. Her exams and quizzes are also all open-note for this class! 10/10 recommend; one of my favorite professors.

Homeworks were about an hour each, 2/3 a week and were the majority of the workload.  Exams and quizzes allowed textbook use where you could look up all answers.  Got over 100% in class by doing bonus (which is 5 question exam and is points equivalent to a homework/quiz).  Lets you work a little ahead on assignments. Great summer course.
Easiest class I've taken at OSU. Didn't watch any lectures, didn't read the textbook. Homework takes forever, but answers can be found by clicking the link to textbook & it brings your to the answer.

Took her during a COVID semester and with a lot of unpleasant things going on politically and personally in my life, Prof. Kendall was always my bright spot throughout the semester! Class is easy and you get to work on a startup wars project! McGraw Hill assignments were boring but still easy to do them! Overall would take her for any course.

Dr. Kendall was absolutely incredible in every way! She obviously loves sharing her knowledge with her students and really understands difficulties that we as college students are faced with. I had some unpleasant other courses my first semester but Dr. Kendall brightened my day every time I saw her over zoom:) I just love her!

Easy class. Great professor, she is knowledgeable and likes to have fun. Lots of extra credit opportunities. Easy open note/open internet take-home exams. Weekly HW and discussion posts. Lectures aren't the most exciting but still valuable. Entertaining guest speakers. Overall I enjoyed this class and would recommend it to anyone interested.
She is the best professor I have ever had! She is so passionate about what she teaches and she genuinely cares about her students and wants the best for them in all ways.

The majority of Busmhr 2500 is just doing a boring start up wars project. I cant say that I leaned much from professor Kendall or the class but it was an easy A. Lots of extra credit opportunities and attendance is not mandatory. You probably wont learn much from the class but it is good GPA boost.

This is one of the best professors I have ever met! Lori is a nice professor and I respect her very much, as she not only brings well-prepared lectures, but also cares about her students. The course materials are interesting and meaningful for business students. I highly recommond taking this course.
Dr. Kendall wasn't a great professor but her class was very easy. She has obvious favorites during class discussions and the class is boring but overall worth taking for the easy A.

Take this class. Trust me. Just take it. The content is interesting, professor is awesome, and a very easy A as long as you keep up with the assignments which is not hard to do. Dr. Kendall is the most caring professor I have ever had. There is also a ton of extra credit opportunities! If you have space for this class, take it!

Dr. Kendall is by far the best college professor I have ever had. She is beyond caring and very knowledgeable about what she teaches. She loves having fun conversations in class. She always makes sure we don't have too much work to do. Tests are pretty easy and there aren't many of them. Homework is also very easy and there isn't much of it.

Professor Kendall is literally one of the best professors I have ever had. She really cares about her students and is incredibly flexible if anything comes up. She presents the material really organized and always answers questions in full detail. She's awesome!!

You just have to attend class, listen to the lectures and it will be an easy A. Professor is really easy to contact and communicate with. The class is different from other classes. Usually a class is really serious and boring, however, in this class Professor Lori manages to keep everything fun. Lots of extra credit offered.
Lori is a great professor. Really cares about her students and wants everyone to learn. The class was pretty easy and you learn useful information that can be used throughout your life.
Best professor I ever had. Really shows she cares a lot about students and wants everyone to do well in her class. Exams are open notes but you still learn.

Dr. Kendall is a very nice and caring professor. She is very passionate and has a lot of experience. Her class is very easy and as long as you keep up with the assignments then you are fine. The exams and quizzes are all online and there is a one page paper due at the end of the semester. I highly recommend this class!

Dr. Kendall is a great professor; arguably the best Ive had in college so far. Her class is very easy to understand and pass so long as you do your homework assignments and participation assignments. Lecture is necessary and contained many guest speakers later in the semester. Highly recommend this class and Dr. Kendall as a professor.

SEI.Subject: ACCTMIS
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Topics in Accounting and MIS

SEI.Subject: BUSMHR
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Topics in Leadership: Building Your Leadership Legacy

SEI.Subject: BUSMHR
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Topics in Leadership: Building Your Leadership Legacy

SEI.Class Name: Advanced Topics in Leadership: Building Your Leadership Legacy

SEI.Class Name: Advanced Topics in Leadership: Building Your Leadership Legacy

SEI.Subject: BUSMHR
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Topics in Leadership: Building Your Leadership Legacy

SEI.Subject: BUSMHR
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Topics in Leadership: Building Your Leadership Legacy

Ratings.comment: This professor is very knowledgeable, but I came to lose my respect for him, as he often talked about students when they were not there to get a laugh out of the class. The 10+ page case study was fine, but we had to use his own way of sourcing, which honestly made the whole process that much more annoying given we needed over 40 sources.

This is the 2nd Dr. Bob class I have taken, and next semester, I am signed up for a 3rd as well as research with him. He truly cares about the students and wants them to get whatever they wish to learn out of the course. Take his class if you are in college to learn rather than to just get a degree.

Dr. Bob is knowledgeable about the info he teaches, the class is challenging but manageable. I felt like with papers he was a hard grader but I ended up finishing with a decent grade even though I some class. If you show that you care and are trying and communicate, he will work with you.

Dr. Woyach expects way too much in this class: a Midterm, 90 minute presentation, 20 page research paper with 40 source, and a written Final. He is a really nice guy and means well, but he grades tough. He's very knowledgeable and it takes along to get a good grade. Too much work for 3 credit hours !!!!!!
This class is so hard. DO NO TAKE IT!!!!!!!!!!

I loved Dr. Bob when I had him for another class and I don't know what went wrong in this one. All semester he seemed clear with his expectations, but then he didn't release our midterm grades until a week before the end of the semester, when we had a 10-page case study and 4-page final paper due. He also grades on a curve, including participation.

The absolute MAN. If you can take a class with Dr. Bob I would highly encourage it. By no means are his classes easy, but he is so clear about what he expects from you and gives you all the help you need to get the grade you desire. He is so lively and fun to listen to in lecture.

Dr. Bob is the best professor I've ever had at OSU, coming from a graduating senior. He is the funniest teacher and is extremely accommodating. While attendance in Model UN is not mandatory, if you don't go to class you will not pass. There are only a few assignments, and one of them is a peer review on your participation during the semester.

Dr. Bob is my favorite professor in the department! He's tough but makes it worth it. He's funny, not overly serious, and genuinely cares for his students. He makes it a point to learn everyone's name. He's also flexible and understanding, so definitely reach out if you're having a hard time. While his lectures aren't mandatory, I recommend going!

Dr. Bob actively encourages his students to think for themselves. You can tell he cares for his students with his quick email replies and willingness to talk after class. GO TO CLASS otherwise you'll bomb the 3 exams and likely do poorly on the 4 papers. Don't really need to read since he explains the content in his lectures.

Bob is pretty funny. The first day he walked in, I already had a great feeling about him and his class. Be sure to have your notes ready, and anything he says regarding the lecture, be sure to write it all down. As attendance wasn't mandatory, I suggest you show up. It's important to hear about these peace tools, to feel what they mean to the world

I really enjoyed Dr. Bob's class and felt that he really cares about his students. He is very knowledgeable in his field and he is very available outside of class. I know for our class we were able to set up study sessions before each midterm. There are three papers and two midterms and then a final paper. Know the definitions and you'll be fine.

Dr. Bob was a great professor and a great person. He works with you and really does make the class fun. That being said, you will not get an A. An A- is absolutely doable but hardly anyone gets As and I wish I had known that. The course only has 4 grades, one which is 40% and he grades harshly. Great class, just be prepared that an A is difficult.

Ive never rated a professor on here before but im here to tell you that Dr. Bob is the best prof OSU has to offer. Love the guy. This is the 3rd class of his ive taken, and he makes you work very hard but you get so much out of it. More than willing to make time to meet with you to answer questions and really wants students to succeed.

Dr. Bob was a wonderful professor. I always looked forward to going to his class, very funny, and willing to help. There are four papers and two exams, so make sure to study up on the definitions taught in class, as they take up a two thirds of the exams. His powerpoints and lectures are very concise and clear, no overthinking needed.

Dr Bob is one of the most intelligent, interesting people I have ever met. That being said, I will never take another class with him. He is an incredibly hard grader that by his own admission will find the best paper, give them an A, and then grade everyone by comparison. You must also memorize lengthy definitions word for word for full credit

Dr. Bob is my favorite professor at OSU. He has tons of knowledge and wants you to learn a piece of it and become a critical thinker. Before the exams, he provides study guides, and I would focus on studying the definitions as he values them the most. Overall, the class was interesting and I am excited for my next class with Dr. Bob.

His lectures are amazing and he works to relate to each student. He is a tough grader, but there are no surprises on the exams. He is, however, very particular on definitions. Make sure to know them work for word from the slides. He will also help with papers, if you want him to review something before you submit.

Dr. Bob is one of my favorite professors at OSU. He won't baby you but also knows that you have much to learn from him, and has a wealth of knowledge to share. He is personable and is totally willing to meet with you outside of class or office hours to discuss almost anything. I can't recommend him enough, even if his classes require some work.

Dr. Bob was the best professor I ever had at OSU. He was the toughest grader I ever had but taking his classes, MUN and Collective Peace and Security, were worth it and you will learn so much. He is a phenomenal lecturer and is a great person to talk to outside of class. Even though he is difficult, he is dedicated to ensuring his students succeed.

Dr. Bob is the best professor you will ever have at OSU. His classes are very interesting and he has a massive working knowledg on all subjects that he teaches. He is always clear and concise and is willing to explain in more detail. He is not a fan of exams, so he makes them as 'simple stupid' as possible. Really down to earth & loves his students

Dr. Woyach expects way too much in this class: a Midterm, 90 minute presentation, 20 page research paper with 40 source, and a written Final. He is a really nice guy and means well, but he grades tough. He's very knowledgeable and it takes along to get a good grade. Too much work for 3 credit hours.

Dr. Bob is great. The class is a lot of work up front (open-book midterm, and 15-20 page paper in the first 5-6 weeks or so) but once you get the hang of things, it's a breeze. I think he was a very fair grader. I would definitely take a class taught by him again.

Dr. Bob is a good guy, he loves what he teaches and has a lot of experience, willing to help u, very intelligent man. Attendance isn't mandatory. You don't need to do the readings. Grades u by a group project, case study paper (11 pgs), midterm and final paper (3 pgs). Not easy to get an A you have to work for it and participate.
Pretty interesting class. Tough to get an A but if you're willing to put in the work, it's easily attainable. Prof Bob is always willing to talk/work with you.Open-book midterm; no final.

Bob at first seems like a stuck up guy, but he really cares about his students and the quality of work they put out.  You will need to work hard to get an A, but he is an understanding guy and always willing to help.  You'll learn a ton!
Prof. woyach is one of the best profs at OSU. VERY funny, always willing to help (even gives out his cell phone number to students) and is very fair. Take his class if you can.
class is a lot of work, but he makes it very interesting.  he is clear and you know what is going to be on the tests.  He holds review sessions too.
No Comments
Grades unnecessarily hard for no reason. Does curve, but there are much easier professors (any other) that teach this course. Avoid if you can and save yourself some unneeded stress

He is really trying to help students to learn and always provide detailed feedback. His class is very interesting with his sense of humor. Not only he taught business strategies but also life strategies. It is true that he is a tough grader, but as long as you read cases, participate, and understand those strategies, you would be fine.

There are three group case assignments in this class. Our group didn't do well on the first assignment, but professor offered to meet with each group in private to help with the next assignment. We met with him on a weekend, and he kept asking us questions regarding the case until he was satisfied we understood everything. Great experience!

He is witty but seems to be more interested in jokes as opposed to content so lectures become draining. He is knowledgeable on the cases and likes to spend time with students, but the grading process seems warped.  Good human overall

There are easier 4490 instructors out there but if you really want to learn something, take his class! Lectures are well organized, team work required for the case analysis. To get an A, make sure you go to class and actually participate. Are you ready to enjoy his humorous, honesty and passion?

He says he doesn't care if you miss class, but as it turns out participation in class is worth 20% of the grade, which is a lot! If you read the case and speak in class a few times every time you'll do well. He tries to make things clear, and will answer to emails even at 2am.

Tibi is one of the most interesting professors at Fisher who often talks about his love for Cane's sauce and Nationwide Cola, but don't let his satirical humor fool you---he is tough! Take any other professor for 4490 and save yourself a semester of struggle. Participation and reading are key to passing otherwise don't expect to graduate!

Although not the easiest grader, he kept me engaged every class and I learned a lot of useful information.  Definitely recommend.  Participate in EVERY class a couple times and read before and you'll do well.
case based teaching - cold calls. if you're not prepared you're not doing good.

I took Professor Khare's recitation. He helps bring the connection between theory and case facts to life. Enjoyed our case discussions and learnt. Read and analyze the case before you get to the class if you wanted to learn.

He is not a good prof at all. I have never seen a prof like him. He speaks to fast even native speaker can't understand him. BUT he truly enjoyed himself. He is such a tough grader. He is soooo strict with everything. I learned nothing. I really regret taking his class. BTW I am a good student who study hard. I am not trying to say sth bad.
You will never get out of class early because he always has many things to say. However, he is insightful and wants the students to think for themselves, friendly prof.
He's a really insightful professor even for graduating seniors. The class has a lot of "busy work", but he's an easy grader so don't stress too much about assignments.
I am having a great time. Never thought about strategy the way Prof Khare is teaching. Truely insightful.
Great case discussions ... great experience
Learnt a lot
Great experience
I learnt a lot via case discussion in recitation section. Come prepared and you will learn a lot. Good professor.
Pay attention and learn a lot...

I felt bad for Nilesh Khare. He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to learn, but no one would read the case material or actively participate because they are all ready to graduate (including myself). He grades fairly easy and if you participate you really will learn something, but there are no tests so you can avoid learning too.
Syllabus warns that you will not learn if you are not preparing. It is so true. Prepare and pay attention to how theories are applied on case facts and you will learn a lot. I did.

With necessarily no right answer Capstone course may mislead you in thinking that you know it.  He does a good job of helping you learn how to analyze cases, ask right questions, match theory and case facts. Focus on logic, be prepared (read theory, read cases), apply yourself and you will learn a lot more. Valuable experience, I will recommend.
He emphasizes logic and reasoning. Make sure you pay attention to how arguments are shaped.

Oh man, avoid this guy! He means well, but you cannot understand him, he is never clear about anything! Keeps you late every time with worthless lectures. But if you have to take him just do you best, and if your in 4490 your almost done! Go Bucks! Again avoid at all cost, I've never said that but its real,
He is a very nice and quirky professor, but the class was uninformative. I enjoyed having him as a professor, but the class felt like a waste of time.

Scott Livengood is one of the best professors I've ever had. He truly cares about his students and his job, it's so inspiring! He literally started to tear up on the last day of class when he was saying his goodbyes. I really want to take another one of his classes

Inspirational lecturer that teaches the conceptual side of entrepreneurship with plenty of relevant examples. Relatively easy class, although the simulation was a bit tough. Was unpleasantly surprised to have to pay over $100 for the TopHat and simulation access. All in all, an enjoyable class and an easy A

I think he is inspirational, thoughtful,interesting, accessible and experienced professor. He makes the business Entrepreneurship such a abstract class becoming interesting and fruitful. I can learn a lot from both him and other classmates.  Even reading the textbook of his class becomes such a joy!!
The Best

He is the best OSU has to offer. If you have a chance to take him, do it! He took the time to really design the course for the benefit of students. He is very receptive to feedback. He highly enjoys teaching and tries his hardest to make sure you enjoy learning. I wrote in his SEI that he deserves a raise. I just loved coming to class. Excellent!
Scott actually cares about whether or not his students know what is going on. He is generous with grading and if something does not work out would be willing to help figure out a solution.
He is a great professor!! Definitely recommend taking his class

Professor Livengood is great! What I really liked about the class was that it was very easy, yet I still learned a lot. No final, 3 exams during semester but you can drop the lowest one. Easy 5 point online quiz due before each class. You're allowed to miss up to 4 class (he takes attendance through 1 question TopHat quizzes). Definitely recommend.

I really enjoyed this class overall, the quizzes and exams are online and there isn't technically homework but the quizzes are basically homework because you have a few a week. He does do participation points through tophat so you do have to attend lecture. The simulation is hard and can be a grade killer because once you mess it up you're screwed.

By far the best professor I've ever seen. He's a cool and laid back dude that cares highly about each of his students and hopes to pass on his wisdom gained by life experiences to everyone and certainly has made a great impact on my semester.

Professor Livengood is a great teacher, clear, funny and Worth Listening to. Quizzes are on small articles and are very easy. There is no final and only 2 of the 3 midterms count. He doesn't make lecture mandatory but it helps with participation points and he really is just an interesting guy to listen to, makes an hour and 20 minutes feel shorter.

He is a great professor who is very passionate about what he is teaching. All of the grades are straightforward- easy quizzes, participation points, easy open note exams.  He makes lectures interesting.  It is a very manageable class and interesting to learn about in general.  Would recommend to anyone.

Professor Livengood kept class entertaining every week and had great real world experiences. The quizzes and exams were not too hard and the exams were open notes. Would recommend this class for anyone even if you're not a business major.
Very funny guy with a very interesting class. Additionally, the "textbook" is a very easy read and very entertaining. Would definently recommend taking entrepreneurship to anyone.
This guy is the bomb. definitely take entrepreneurship if you have the opportunity
Great lectures. Didn't even feel like the class was an hour and a half long. He holds your attention very well and is very in to class discussions.

Dr. Livengood is a great professor who is passionate about business. His class was straightforward and enjoyable as he always kept the class engaged and participating. Even though I'm not a business major I thoroughly enjoyed this class as he made it very interesting and easy to understand.
THE BEST PROFESSOR IN OSU

Entrepreneurship is a super easy class, do the work and you'll pretty much get an A. Only 3 exams- all online and there isn't class the week of them. Lecture attendance isn't required at all but he's a genuinely interesting and funny guy, so they aren't bad if you go! The simulation is kind of tough but if you get it down, you're golden.
The best professor ever

BEST PROFESSOR AT OHIO STATE. This class is interesting and you actually learn quite a bit. Required to do a simulation online (owning your own bike shop) which sounds intimidating at first, but its easily passable. You can also drop one exam and four quiz score which is great. TAKE THIS CLASS - easy A!

Scott was a great professor who actually cared about his students.  I enjoyed getting to know him as a person throughout the semester as we shared stories about our own situations in class.  A wonderful person and wonderful professor.  Would definitely reccomend this class.
Best professor I've had at OSU! Easy quizzes and exams

He is so helpful and kind. I observed his Entrepreneur class so he had to sign a request paper for me, he was so kind and asked me where I'm from. He is so funny and the best thing in the class is that he bring examples from the real world like Starbucks, apple, samsung etc. You will really enjoy it.

I would strongly recommend taking Artie's course if he ever returns--and to count yourself lucky if he does. Artie's provocative teaching style and acerbic wit alone is worth the price of admission but it is his legacy of inspiring students, stimulating deep introspection, and fostering creativity that is the true prize.

Artie is by far my favorite teacher. He is very interested in developing the student's skills and is willing to go the extra mile in helping them achieve their professional goals. He follows up with his students after taking the class to give regular updates and to reassure those that he is available to help. Easily the best professor and class.

Artie is by far one of my favorite professors at Fisher. No doubt. One year out of college, I can't say with full confidence that any of the classes I took at OSU in four years changed my life, but Artie's. Warning: This class will make you seriously doubt many pointless (mandatory) classes offered at Fisher.

This class was worth the 4 years I spent at Ohio State. It teaches you hundreds of different ways you can achieve a high level of creativity. It inspires you to follow your dreams and set high goals that can be achieved if you put in the work. Artie is a master at lecturing and generating discussion among the classroom during lectures.

Artie's personal creativity class is a life changing course that opens your mind to personal freedom in this world of rules and norms.  It inspired me to travel and not take time, our most precious asset, for granted.

Amazing speaker.  Cant say I learned much about business, but a lot of life skills and general good tips.  Even if you dont want to learn, or care about the material, just the honor of listening to him speak is worth taking the class for. Most days i went were just to listen to him rather than the goal of learning about business.

Artie was one of my favorite professors ever. His class teaches you about life. It sounds ridiculous, but you really do learn how to appreciate life, be happier, be more intentional, and be more creative with whatever you do.

Artie Isaac has easily been my favorite professor at Ohio State. Personal Creativity and Innovation is a class I would recommend for all OSU students, regardless of major. His wisdom is abundant, and he really cares about his students.
Great class and great professor!

Artie Isaac has changed my view on management. He inspired me tremendously to have an open mind and to think more creatively. I would take his class again if I could because he made class fun and interesting at the same time. His humor and experiences kept my attention at all times. I wish I went to office hrs and overall AWESOME JOB Artie!!!!!!!!

Artie Isaac is among the most interesting, inspiring, and knowledgeable professors I have ever had the pleasure to learn from. He is a pleasant and comical man that made every class a joy to attend. Word of advice: Go to his office hours! He has a lot to offer and, quite frankly, 4hrs a week isn't enough time with him. He is the Netflix of E-Books!

Awesome class! I was consistently entertained, and inspired.  Keep up with the writing and definitely go to class because that is where you will get the most value.  I would take the class over again.  He is interested in helping any way he can.  He is quirky, intelligent, and has a lot of insight from people he knows.

If nothing else, it was frustrating to take this class.. Not because Artie was bad. Contrarily, because it was so good, that I realized the true possibilities of education when the instructor is engaged and enthusiastic. Artie should be teaching other teachers how to teach. THIS CLASS CHANGED MY LIFE. Take it.. Bravo, Artie! BRAVO!
Best there is. Life Changing.
Artie is a very good teacher who will make you see life with a different point of view. There is a lot of work to do but easy and very helpful.

Artie is an awesome teacher. The things I have learned in his class I will take with me throughout life. If you are open minded and are looking to learn about how to live and work with more creativity and happiness this is the class for you. There is a decent amount of writing, but it is mostly about yourself, so it shouldn't be too difficult.
He is easily one of the best professors at OSU. He is very engaging and would do anything to help his students. I would recommend this class to anyone.

class was such a relief to go to, never any pressure just useful knowledge everyday...i tell ppl this was my best class so far at OSU. artie is def a "wise guy", prob got beat up a few times in his life for smartin off, but he's an adjunct teacher so if he happens to be teaching a class here take it! 390 was the kinda class i came to college for.
Easily the best professor I've ever had at Ohio State. Taking a class with Artie will be one of the better decisions you make in college. He's extremely knowledgeable and funny. Take his class.
He is a great teacher and you can really learn a lot from him. His knowledge is endless.
Great teacher, fun class, easy A if you do the work and participate in class.
Great teacher and excellent speaker.  His class is enjoyable and I would recommend it to anyone.
Previous comment sounds like Artie posted it.
Artie is the man, just go to class on a consistent basis and you will acheive great things.  He makes the business world actually seem interesting.

This was a pretty easy class, Baldrick is a funny/nice guy. Midterm/Final both easy;  Absolutely do NOT need the book. There are two smaller projects (still take a bit of work), a fairly involved final project, and attendance is taken every day. Overall good class, very easy to get an A. Recommend Baldrick after taking him for 731/736

Professor Baldrick was a good guy--lots of experience to back up his teaching. Midterms and final were very fair based off of material presented in class; pulled off an A without too much trouble. Absolutely do NOT need the book. There are some pretty easy quizzes, a fairly involved project, and attendance is taken every day. Overall good class
Cases are ridiculously hard, he gives very little help. He rarely would respond to e-mails, and when he did it wasn't helpful. Hated this class with a passion.
Class is very bland and boring not being in operations/logistics. Takes attendance most days. Two group case projects which are much more difficult than need be. Avoid if you can.
he is very useless and has no respect for students. I emailed him asking a question and his exact answer was "No." and no email ending or anything. Avoid him at all costs. Useless.
This professor is really strict.

Brett is a really nice & caring professor.  His lectures were a little confusing & rambling at times, but I think this was his first time teaching the course.  If you go ot his office hours, he's great at answering your questions one-on-one, and will work with you until you fully understand everything.  Overall, I was very happy with him as a prof

Brett was a good teacher for BM330. His exams are tough , but he gives a nice curve. He is all about being able to interpret stats not just know calculations. Gives take home quizzes and exams are all multiple choice. Great in office hours, case studies are time consuming. Overall, Im glad i had him for this course.
Not a bad prof, but requires lots of work outside the class to get everything.  No homeworks.  Exams are tough.

exams are really challenging. focusing in this class is almost impossible and clarity is lacking. i don't think i've learned anything. prior knowledge from 133 is the only thing getting me through this class.

The fact that he gets paid is unreal. Literally a detriment to my learning. Will "black out" as he refered to it once or mumble during the class. Does not give any review material. Reads straight from the slides. Biggest waste of a professor I have ever had.
I can't believe this dude is allowed to teach. The worst professor I've ever had at OSU.
